author: av8r1973
title: Simple, to the point, effective
review:
Not a lot to review here.  It's an IR receiver that does exactly what it's supposed to do.  I will say that the ability to use multiple models at the same time is nice.  While using it with my trains, the Excavator kit doesn't take off out of control.  The unit is compact enough to fit in most models, and the receiver window is unobtrusive.  It fits naturally into the scale of many models and looks like a domed 2x2 black window.

 

The claimed range of 30' is accuate.  What isn't mentioned is that it works indirectly, too.  Corners or kids are no match for it.

 

One complaint for LEGO (not specifically against this kit) is that Power Functions kits should be available.  Rather than piecing together various PF components for a train - sell a kit!  Same is true for motorizing models - sell a kit including motors, receivers, transmitters and battery packs.  Another solution is to offer these components on a LDD setup that error-checks to make sure you have all necessary components.  PF adds so much to LEGO sets, so I can't believe that LEGO would let this slide.


Overall, worth the money!
